Quotes: The real passion of the twentieth century is servitude.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: Nothing is so intolerable to man as being fully at rest, without a passion, without business, without entertainment, without care.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: I think we can really use magic in a way never attempted before to inspire these children, help rally their self-confidence and even help them develop social skills. This is a national effort, not just here in Las Vegas. I know we can give them a true passion.
Author: Criss Angel

Quotes: In diving to the bottom of pleasure we bring up more gravel than pearls.
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quotes: People can have many different kinds of pleasure. The real one is that for which they will forsake the others.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: I believe we are still so innocent. The species are still so innocent that a person who is apt to be murdered believes that the murderer, just before he puts the final wrench on his throat, will have enough compassion to give him one sweet cup of water.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quotes: Anyone who seeks to destroy the passions instead of controlling them is trying to play the angel.
Author: Voltaire
